results.title: In Arizona’s race for governor, Hobbs defies expectations and takes a narrow lead.
results.abstract: The Democratic candidate’s mild manner has been a counterweight to her rival Kari Lake’s charismatic and antagonistic style.

media.caption: Katie Hobbs, Arizona’s secretary of state and the Democrats’ candidate for governor, in Mesa, Ariz., on Monday.
media.copyright: Caitlin O'Hara for The New York Times

results.byline: By Jesse McKinley and Nicholas Fandos
results.title: Sean Patrick Maloney Concedes to Mike Lawler in Major Loss for Democrats
results.abstract: Mr. Maloney, who leads the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee, was seeking to represent a different district after New York’s messy redistricting process.

media.caption: Representative Sean Patrick Maloney, delivering a concession speech on Wednesday, led the Democratic Party’s campaign operation in the House.
media.copyright: Kenny Holston for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Voting and Voters;Elections;Boebert, Lauren;Republican Party;Colorado
results.title: Lauren Boebert is in an unexpectedly tight House race in Colorado.
results.abstract: Representative Lauren Boebert, a Republican, is being challenged by Adam Frisch, a Democrat.

media.caption: Representative Lauren Boebert of Colorado, a Republican, during a debate with her opponent, Adam Frisch, at Colorado Mesa University in Grand Junction, Colo., in September.
media.copyright: William Woody for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, House of Representatives;Content Type: Personal Profile;Redistricting and Reapportionment;Maloney, Sean Patrick;Democratic Party;House of Representatives;New York Post;Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee;New York State
results.title: Sean Patrick Maloney on His Loss, the Media and A.O.C.
results.abstract: Mr. Maloney said that he and other New York Democrats were unable to overcome suburban fears of crime. He also had some harsh words for Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez.

media.caption: Representative Sean Patrick Maloney said that Gov. Kathy Hochul's struggles in the suburbs hurt Democratic candidates in those areas.
media.copyright: Kenny Holston for The New York Times

results.title: Jury Says Paul Haggis Raped Woman After Film Premiere
results.abstract: Mr. Haggis, a writer of the Oscar-winning films “Crash” and “Million Dollar Baby,” was sued by a film publicist after a 2013 encounter in his New York apartment.

media.caption: Paul Haggis said that a sexual encounter after a film premiere in 2013 was consensual. His accuser said she was raped in his apartment.
media.copyright: Julia Nikhinson/Associated Press

results.title: Here are the uncalled races that could determine control of Congress.
results.abstract: Both chambers of Congress remained up for grabs, with crucial contests that could determine control yet to be called.

media.caption: An election worker processed ballots at the Maricopa County Election Center in Phoenix today. Arizona’s Senate race is one of the key contests around the country that have yet to be called.
media.copyright: Alisha Jucevic for The New York Times

results.title: ‘The Crown’ Review: The Worst of Times
results.abstract: The fifth season of the Netflix hit, with a new cast including Imelda Staunton as the queen, depicts the royal family at its lowest point.

results.title: How Georgia’s Senate Runoff Will Work

results.title: Democratic Hopes Rise on Senate Control as Two States Count Votes
results.abstract: In Arizona and Nevada, Republicans’ path to victory appeared to narrow, though both races remain close. The G.O.P.’s odds of success are greater in the House.

media.caption: As ballots were counted in Arizona, Senator Mark Kelly was ahead of Blake Masters, his Republican rival. The state’s race for governor was significantly tighter.

results.title: A Vatican Auditor Says He Dug Up Too Much Dirt, and Was Buried
results.abstract: Libero Milone is suing the Vatican for wrongful dismissal after he said he found cardinals siphoning off funds. The Vatican has hit him with a criminal investigation of its own.

media.caption: Pope Francis meeting with Libero Milone, now a former Vatican auditor general, in a 2016 photo released by a Vatican newspaper.
media.copyright: L'Osservatore Romano/via Associated Press

results.title: If Democrats Lose the House, They May Have New York to Blame
results.abstract: Republicans flipped four congressional seats in New York, the most of any state in the country. How did this happen in one of the nation’s most liberal states?

media.caption: The Republican candidate for governor, Lee Zeldin, helped his party make inroads in pockets of Brooklyn that normally lean Democratic.
media.copyright: Anna Watts for The New York Times

results.title: What to Know as the Trump Organization’s Trial Resumes

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, Senate;Elections, House of Representatives;United States Politics and Government;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Democratic Party;Republican Party
results.title: Biden Celebrates Beating the Odds, but He Faces a New Challenge
results.abstract: President Biden appeared to have the best midterms of any president in 20 years, avoiding the “shellacking” his predecessors endured. But even a narrow Republican majority could transform his presidency.

media.caption: President Biden scored the best midterm result of any president in 20 years, avoiding a predicted Republican surge.
media.copyright: Doug Mills/The New York Times

results.title: Warren Beatty Is Accused of Sexually Assaulting a Minor in 1973
results.abstract: In a lawsuit filed this week, the plaintiff says Mr. Beatty groomed and coerced her into sex when she was 14 and 15. The actor, who had starred in “Bonnie and Clyde,” was about 35 at the time.

media.caption: The plaintiff says Warren Beatty caused her “severe emotional, physical and psychological distress.”
media.copyright: Mark Von Holden/Invision, via Associated Press
